content.twitter:
My biggest struggle with Claude Code? Context window management.

Spent weeks building workarounds - creating sub-agents, delegating tasks between them, basically architecting my own memory system just to keep sessions from falling apart.

Then the latest releases dropped.

Turns out Claude Code now does this automatically. The thing I spent hours engineering? Built-in.

3 things I noticed after the update:

1/ Sessions stay coherent way longer
2/ It handles task delegation on its own
3/ Less "wait, what were we doing?" moments mid-project

Not saying it's perfect. But the difference is noticeable.

Anyone else been fighting context window issues? What workarounds did you build that are now obsolete?
